author: joshcorr
body:
## Steps to reproduce

Launch PowerShell 7.0.x version.

## Expected behavior

Launching LTS version of PowerShell should not notify of a new version _until_ there is a new subversion of the current LTS, or a new Major version of LTS for those that are opting to stay on LTS for its supported lifecycle. 

## Actual behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13426972/102527146-b27a4280-406a-11eb-80a6-cd71eb03d20b.png)


## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none

PSEdition                      Core

```
Note: I realize this might not be a bug, but rather a feature request, so please feel free to recategorize.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@joshcorr Please look a description of the feature https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/11132
Does POWERSHELL_UPDATECHECK=LTS resolve your issue?

comments.author: joshcorr
comments.body:
Didn't realize that this was an option. Read up on it here a bit. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/about/about_update_notifications?view=powershell-7.1 Going to test it out and report back. Should that environment variable be created on install of 7.0.3?
about_Update_Notifications - PowerShell
Notifies users on startup of PowerShell that a new version of PowerShell has been released.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> Should that environment variable be created on install of 7.0.3?

It is an option. You need to create this manually.

comments.author: joshcorr
comments.body: Thanks for pointing this out @iSazonov. This works for me. I was able to set it as a system wide environment variable (which is what I was hoping for), but imagine one could also set it as a user specific environment variable.

title: PowerShell 7.0.x shows warning about new non LTS versions
